meanings.definition: The part of a scene or picture that is nearest to the viewer.
meanings.sent1: In the painting, the foreground showed a beautiful garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the focus to capture the details in the foreground of the image.
meanings.sent3: The foreground of the picture seemed to come alive, as if inviting the viewer to step in.
meanings.sent4: Her presence in the foreground of the group photo symbolized her importance in the team.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully used light and shadow to create depth in the foreground of the landscape.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to foreground the importance of teamwork in her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The speaker used gestures to foreground the key points of his speech.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to foreground his achievements came across as a bit too boastful.
meanings.sent4: The bold font was used to foreground the title on the cover page.
meanings.sent5: The director chose to foreground the emotional journey of the main character in the film.
